[[Image:Googler2-non.jpg|right|thumb|A [[license plate]] seen in the Googleplex parking lot]]
â
The basic salaries at Google were until recently considered to be quite low compared to industry standards. For instance, [[system administrator]]s earned no more than $33,000–37,000: is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels, but this may no longer be accurate information.
+
The basic salaries at Google were, before the IPO, considered to be quite low compared to industry standards. For instance, some [[system administrator]]s earned no more than $33,000–37,000: is considered to be low by [[San Francisco Bay Area|Bay Area]] standard levels, but excellent stock performance has left early employees well compensated.
â
However, despite the low salaries, Google's strong brand and stellar prospects (relative to most Bay Area companies) continue to attract far more applicants than there are positions available. As a result, Google reportedly had to hire one in-house legal recruiter just to help the legal department sort through resumes from job-hungry [[lawyer]]s.
+
Beyond monetary compensation, Google's workplace amenities, culture, global popularity and stellar prospects (relative to most Bay Area companies), and strong brand continue to attract far more applicants than there are positions available. As a result, Google reportedly had to hire one in-house legal recruiter just to help the legal department sort through resumes from job-hungry [[lawyer]]s.
